page.title: 20ARMED FORCES IN CHITTERNE
page.content: Situated on the boundary of the Salisbury Plain Training Area midway between the School of Infantry at Warminster and the School of Artillery at Larkhill, the village is both home to several military families and a focal point for training exercises on the Plain. In almost any month during the year, most types of military tracked and wheeled vehicle can be seen on the roads and the village is a convenient reference point for helicopters, ground attack fighters and transport aircraft with paratroops exercising with the Army. Progress of exercises is evident when north or east winds bring the sound of heavy guns at Larkhill, the crack of small arms and mortars from infantry assaults on Imber village and the grind of tanks and personnel carriers negotiating the gullies.
